New Records: The Oklahoma City Thunder achieved a franchise-record 15th consecutive win
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 33 points and grabbed 11 rebounds
Key Match Events: The Thunder trimmed the deficit and regained the lead with free throws by Jalen Williams
Lu Dort made two crucial 3-pointers late in the game
Boston Celtics struggled with 3-point shooting, making only 9 out of 46 attempts
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder's coach highlighted the victory as a significant step in their quest for the championship
Boston Celtics' poor 3-point shooting was a key factor in their loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was held at the Paycom Center with an attendance of 18,203 fans
The Thunder held a line of -0.5 and the over/under was set at 225.5
Others: The game was a crucial moment in the Thunder's strong season, showcasing their resilience and offensive depth
